TopicTitle: Boeing has a "Build, Fly, Dream" style advertisment???

Articles.Content:
OK, this just happened, and I'm still chuckling. I was in the kitchen, making coffee, and NASA TV was on the computer in the other room.
Everything was quiet, when suddenly I thought I heard the music from "Build, Fly, Dream"...
On NASA TV???

So I turned on the coffee maker and hurried back to the computer... and it was an advertisement for Boeing! Exactly in the style of "Build, Fly, Dream"... even the music, while not the same, was almost a perfect mimic!

This ad was either a blatant copy... or a beautifully subtle shout-out to KSP.

Makes me wonder if someone in the Boeing Ad department plays KSP.... lol.
Does anyone have a link to it? I too want to exhale through my nose and smile slightly in amusement.
yes i want to see this. link?

This one?

[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=etOABxGbCMY[/url]

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]

I'm usually very sceptical when it comes to "rip off" claims but the similarity is uncanny. Of course maybe it went the other way around but given that Esau's publication date of the video predates the Boeing one with a year and half that seems highly unlikely.

[quote name='Just Jim']Makes me wonder if someone in the Boeing Ad department plays KSP.... lol.[/QUOTE]
Someone? I think everyone in the entire aerospace industry plays it.

M83 Outro is pretty common... Although that's an understatement.

Plus, certain types of imagery are of the kind that go with that music.

nice add thks for sharing:

blablabla over a half century ...

[I]United States[/I] travelled to space ... blablabla ... legacy

just a minor thing anyway, may be next time, i mean there already flag everywhere, america repeated by the speaker just after etc. slighty too redundant imho ; ) Edited November 17, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''
